00001 //-*- mode:C++ ; c-basic-offset: 2 -*-
00002 #include "DF_Proj_Point.hpp"

00008 using namespace std;

00010 namespace DFLib

00015     // class Point
00016     Point::Point(const vector<double> &uPosition,vector<string> &projArgs)
00017       : theUserCoords(uPosition),
00018         userDirty(true),
00019         mercDirty(false)
00020     {
00021       // Create the proj.4 stuff.  This is highly inefficient, as it should
00022       // live in the base class, not each object.  Fix that.
00023       
00024       char *mercator_argv[3]={"proj=merc",
00025                               "ellps=WGS84",
00026                               "lat_ts=0"};
00027 
00028       int numUserArgs = projArgs.size();
00029       char **user_argv = new char * [numUserArgs];
00030 
00031       for (int i=0; i<numUserArgs; ++i)
00032       {
00033         user_argv[i]=new char [projArgs[i].size()+1];
00034         projArgs[i].copy(user_argv[i],projArgs[i].size());
00035         // Null terminate the string!
00036         user_argv[i][projArgs[i].size()] = '\0';
00037       }
00038 
00039       if (!(userProj = pj_init(numUserArgs,user_argv)))
00040       {
00041         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize user projection"));
00042       }
00043       
00044       if (!(mercProj = pj_init(3,mercator_argv)))
00045       {
00046         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize mercator projection"));
00047       }
00048       
00049       // Don't bother trying to force the mercator --- we'll do that if
00050       // we query, because we're setting userDirty to true, just initialize
00051       // to junk.
00052       theMerc.resize(2,0.0);
00053       
00054     }
00055     
00056     Point::Point(const Point &right)
00057       : userProj(right.userProj),
00058         mercProj(right.mercProj)
00059     {
00060       if (right.mercDirty)
00061       {
00062         // Right's mercator's been changed without its LL being 
00063         // updated, so copy its mercator values and say we're dirty.
00064         theMerc=right.theMerc;
00065         mercDirty=true;
00066       } 
00067       else
00068       {
00069         // Just copy its LL and mark dirty.
00070         theUserCoords=right.theUserCoords;
00071         userDirty=true;
00072       }
00073     }
00074     
00075     void Point::setXY(const vector<double> &mPosition)
00076     {
00077       theMerc = mPosition;
00078       // Essential to set userDirty=false, otherwise getXY will try to 
00079       // convert ll and we'll be wrong.
00080       mercDirty=true;  
00081       userDirty=false;
00082     }
00083 
00084     void Point::setUserProj(vector<string> &projArgs)
00085     {
00086       int numUserArgs = projArgs.size();
00087       char **user_argv = new char * [numUserArgs];
00088       for (int i=0; i<numUserArgs; ++i)
00089       {
00090         user_argv[i]=new char [projArgs[i].size()+1];
00091         projArgs[i].copy(user_argv[i],projArgs[i].size());
00092       }
00093       if (!(userProj = pj_init(numUserArgs,user_argv)))
00094       {
00095         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize user projection"));
00096       }
00097     }      
00098     
00099     const vector<double> & Point::getXY()
00100     {
00101       if (userDirty)
00102       {
00103         // our LL has been changed, so update
00104         userToMerc();
00105       }
00106       return(theMerc);
00107     }
00108 
00109     void Point::setUserCoords(const vector<double> &llPosition)
00110     {
00111       theUserCoords = llPosition;
00112       // If we set ll, must now trump mercator.
00113       userDirty=true; mercDirty=false;
00114     }
00115 
00116     const vector<double> & Point::getUserCoords()
00117     {
00118       if (mercDirty)
00119       {
00120         // our LL has been changed, so update
00121         mercToUser();
00122       }
00123       return(theUserCoords);
00124     }
00125     
00126     Point * Point::Clone()
00127     {
00128       Point *retPoint;
00129       retPoint = new Point(*this);
00130       return retPoint;
00131     }
00132 
00133     void Point::userToMerc()
00134     {
00135       projUV data;
00136       double z;
00137       if (pj_is_latlong(userProj))
00138       {
00139         data.u = theUserCoords[0]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00140         data.v = theUserCoords[1]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00141       }
00142       z=0;
00143       if (pj_transform(userProj,mercProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00144       {
00145         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting user coords to Mercator"));
00146       }
00147 
00148       theMerc.resize(2);
00149       theMerc[0]=data.u;
00150       theMerc[1]=data.v;
00151 
00152       userDirty=false;
00153     }      
00154 
00155 
00156     void Point::mercToUser()
00157     {
00158       projUV data;
00159       double z;
00160       data.u = theMerc[0];
00161       data.v = theMerc[1];
00162       z=0;
00163       if (pj_transform(mercProj,userProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00164       {
00165         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting Mercator to LL"));
00166       }
00167       theUserCoords.resize(2);
00168       if (pj_is_latlong(userProj))
00169       {
00170         theUserCoords[0]=data.u*RAD_TO_DEG;
00171         theUserCoords[1]=data.v*RAD_TO_DEG;
00172       }
00173       mercDirty=false;
00174     }      
00175   }
00176 }
